author: Laurent Shinar
title: Feline Freakout: 30 Hilariously Unhinged Feline Funnies of the Not-So-Keen Cat Children Causing Chaos Ahead of Christmas
text:
Well, nothing in life is perfect is it? And why should the Christmas season be any different, other than its urge to make everything perfect and peaceful. Because of course there are those among us who could be [considered Scrooges](https://cheezburger.com/23520261/pawsitively-grinchy-24-pics-from-a-funny-feline-that-hates-holidays), and they want nothing more than to ruin this fantastically festive time of year of everyone else. But fear not faithful fur baby loving hoomans, for we have rallied together a list of hilariously unhinged feline funnies of the not-so-keen cat children who will be causing chaos ahead of Christmas, to make sure you are ready for whatever your [clawminal cat ](https://cheezburger.com/25124869/20-clawminal-cat-memes-for-non-pawrents-to-remind-you-why-you-dont-have-a-cat)might have to throw at you this year.
From the breaking bad catto who has taken Halloween a little too far into the year, to the [chonky cat](https://cheezburger.com/37663493/24-cute-chonky-cats-celebrating-a-cheerful-carbs-season-by-impurrsonating-your-round-thanksgiving) who single-handedly put Red Lobster out of business with his shrimp obsession, to the financially fortuitous feline who is proud of his $100 shopping haul consisting of four food items.
If you have ever wondered who ends up eating the cookies that are left out for Santa to consume on his delivery route, then you have found the culprit. Some say that this is a bad omen, which is probably what this cat was going for. And now it's time to get the vacuum…
This frenetic fella is seriously riled up to put out such a serious sentiment. While it is not exactly clear how he intends to specifically fight, a profile picture is not clear. But however he intends to do it, you can bet that he is going to do it.
For a weekly dose of animal-themed community challenges - [Subscribe to our Newsletter!](https://icanhascheezburger.beehiiv.com/subscribe?utm_source=Web&utm_medium=CTA&utm_campaign=signupcta)
Can't get enough of ICanHasCheezburger? [Find us on Instagram!](https://www.instagram.com/icanhascheezburgerz/)

author: Elizabeth Worthington
title: Maryland woman sending her DNA and husband's ashes into deep space
text:
CROWNSVILLE, Md. — In life, husband and wife Oren and Bill went above and beyond to bring star trek to earth, Whether it was designing their basement to look like the interior of the starship "Enterprise," or meeting as many members of the cast and crew as they could, or even renewing their wedding vows on a replica of Enterprise with a Klingon as a witness.
Now, the couple's fandom is extending beyond earth's atmosphere.
"When he died, I thought, I want to fulfill his wish of going to space," said Oren Whyche-Shaw.
Lieutenant Colonel Bill Shaw always wanted to be an astronaut. He went to the Air Force Academy, but at the time, NASA didn't allow people who needed glasses or contacts to pursue training.
But his love for space never faded, and he found an outlet for his passion in adventures with his fellow "Trekkie" wife.
When he passed away unexpectedly from an illness in 2017, she decided his passion needed to live on.
"We're looking at the orbit of my husband in the first flight - the Heritage flight - and that little satellite is where he is - so I can track him any time day or night," Oren explained as she showed us the tracker on her TV.
His remains are currently orbiting around the Earth thanks to a company called "Celestis." The company has been offering memorial spaceflights since the 90s.
"To me it's just a very natural service for people that are interested in space or science fiction. It's equivalent to scattering ashes at sea, except it's a lot harder. A lot harder," said Celestis co-founder Charles Chafer.
Eventually, the satellite carrying his ashes will burn out.
"The laws of physics take over, and the spacecraft, including our passengers, burns up in the atmosphere upon reentry in its entirety, making it sort of an 'ashes to ashes' experience."
But the ever-inventive Oren found a way to make her husband a part of the universe for eternity. She learned Celestis was starting to offer "forever" missions, sending satellites into deep space, where they'll orbit endlessly.
"And I thought, okay I did the first launch for Bill. But this one, this could be for us."
So Oren's going with him, where "no one has gone before" - at least, a piece of her DNA is.
Although the couple is no longer together Earth-side; in space, they'll literally be together forever.
"So he wouldn't be able to get rid of me - ha!" she joked.
It gets better. They'll be joined by the remains of five members of the Star Trek: Enterprise cast and crew, including the creator Gene Rodenberry, Nichelle Nichols, DeForest Kelley, and James “Scotty” Doohan.
The rocket, built by the United Launche Alliance, is scheduled to launch on January 8 from Cape Canaveral. It's aptly named the Vulcan rocket, and the mission is called the Enterprise Flight. This will be the first time the company is sending remains into deep space.

author: Jeremy Jojola
title: Who was Julia Greeley? | wltx.com
text: DENVER — As thousands of Colorado Catholics celebrate Holy Week, many of them are finding hope in Julia Greeley, a woman whose life story may convince the pope to declare her a saint. “She never knew that she mattered. But she mattered,” said Dr. Barbara Wilcots, who sat on an [Archdiocese of Denver](https://archden.org/julia-greeley/) committee that researched Greeley’s life. In 2016, the archdiocese opened the cause for sainthood and sent about 11,000 pages of documents to the Vatican. The Vatican is currently reviewing the case. Wilcots expressed the importance of Greeley’s potential canonization because she is one of only six Black Americans being considered for sainthood within the Catholic Church. “For that person to have been formerly enslaved, and to be a woman, and to be Black, I think is really important,” Wilcots said. “It really humanizes what it means to be a saint, because as we are Catholic, we are all called to be saints.” Greeley’s story Greeley, who was born into slavery in Missouri and was eventually emancipated, came to Colorado in the 1800s and worked as a housekeeper. In the only photo of her in existence, her right eye appears to be closed. According to her story, a slavemaster’s whip hit Greeley’s eye while she was a baby being held in her mother’s arms. Church records show Greeley became deeply devout to the Catholic Church after she was baptized at Denver’s Sacred Heart Catholic Church, where she was known to pray. Greeley was known to ask for items like food, toys, coal and bedding from the families she would work for and then carry them in a red wagon throughout Denver. She would deliver goods to the needy at night, because many of them were white and didn’t want to be seen getting help from a Black woman. “She did it at the back door at night and tried to do it as secretly as possible,” said Rev. Blaine Burkey, who wrote a biography on Greeley. “She had so many reasons to be bitter,” Burkey said. “She didn't spend her time taking it out on anybody. She spent it helping other people.” “Anytime she heard there were poor people who needed something, she did what she could to try and help them,” Burkey said. One miracle believers attribute to Greeley is the birth of a child to a family who suffered the loss of a child. The woman was told she could no longer have another baby. Greeley, who worked for the family, said a baby would come soon. “And Julia told her, ‘Don’t worry. Pretty soon there will be a little angel running around the house.’ And in fact, not long after that, the woman found out she was going to have a child,” Wilcots said. The child can be seen in the only photo of Greeley that exists. Because of the story of the miracle child, Burkey said he has received notes and letters from people around the world who struggled to have children. The parents said Greeley had given them hope, and some reported conception. “Once her cause was opened, that became worldwide,” Burkey said of Greeley’s growing fame. When Greeley died in 1918, local newspapers reported thousands of people in Denver came to see her body because of her reputation of being devoted to the church and the needy. Soon after the Denver Archdiocese opened a cause for sainthood in 2016, Greeley’s remains were exhumed at Mount Olivet Cemetery and transferred to the Cathedral Basilica of the Immaculate Conception in Denver. From 2018: [Julia Greeley's tomb gets a new home](/article/news/local/next/julia-greeleys-tomb-gets-a-new-home/73-560078192) Today, visitors to the basilica can see a large marble sarcophagus with Greely’s name carved into the stone, which also displays the symbol of the Sacred Heart. A forensic anthropologist found Greeley’s bones were riddled with arthritis. Wilcots said it’s likely Greeley experienced discomfort and pain when she walked the streets of Denver at night to help the needy. “She put her own pain and her own personal affliction aside, and just to see that someone has the capacity, it makes your own affliction seem less of a concern,” Wilcots said. The time frame on when the Vatican will make a decision on Greeley’s sainthood is unknown, but historically it can take decades for the pope to canonize someone who is a candidate. Wilcots doesn’t expect the decision to come in her lifetime, but holds hope and admiration for Greeley. “When you think about someone who went about their business living the way we are called to live, caring about people, and sacrificing whatever you have, it makes the possibility of sainthood seem real,” Wilcots said. If you have any information about this story or would like to send a news tip, you can contact . SUGGESTED VIDEOS: [Colorado’s Leading Ladies](https://youtube.com/playlist?list=PLlV2Iuo79CuqQEk0buK0v2FAm779aBdF3)

author: Chibuike Chukwu
title: Daniel Ford Elite Youth National Table Tennis Tourney, Hub For Nigerians In Diaspora
text:
Features Latest News By Chibuike Chukwu On Dec 26, 2024 0 1 Share Facebook Twitter Google+ WhatsApp Every December, in the past two years, the Molade-Okoya Thomas Indoor Sports Hall of the Telsim Balogun Stadium in Lagos becomes the hub for Nigerians in the diaspora living in the United Kingdom.
Most of the time, Nigerians living abroad far and near choose a day or more in December to come home and celebrate for different reasons.
Vacation, wedding, house warming, family reunion, traditional and religious activities are some of the reasons Nigerians in the diaspora visit the country during the yuletide.
In its first of a kind, table tennis has now joined the long list of reasons Nigerians in the Diaspora travel home during December; this is as a result of the annual Daniel Ford Elite Youth National Table Tennis Championships that takes place at the prestigious Molade-Okoya Thomas Indoor Sports Hall, which has hosted world ranking events like Table Tennis, Squash, Badminton, Karate and a whole of lots of world-class events.
The event, which is on the calendar of the African Table Tennis Federation, the body governing table tennis in Africa, Nigeria Table Tennis Federation, and on the bucket list of thousands of table tennis players in West Africa, has made Telsim Balogun Stadium a tourist centre .
To prove my assertion, the two-day events, which started with a two-day training clinic and ended on Saturday, the 22nd, has the Chairman/CEO of Nigerians in Diaspora Commission (NiDCOM) Abike Dabiri-Erewa, as the special guest at the grand finale.
In her interview with Journalists, Abike lauded the sponsor, Yemi Edun, a philanthropist and a property developer in London for investing in youth development through sports.
She also called on other Nigerians in the diaspora to take a cue from the real estate expert. “I commend Yemi Edun for returning home to sponsor this kind of tournament that helps unearth talents. I appeal to other Nigerians in the Diaspora to emulate him by seeing what they can do to help our youths in the country,”
With 66 youths across the nation in four different categories of events – U19 Boys & Girls and U15 Boys & Girls, the Daniel Ford Elite Youth National Table Tennis Championships has given hope to Nigerian youths to shun vices in society.
Advertisement It’s also worth mentioning that the event is the most competitive table tennis tournament in West Africa, which is evident in the emergence of new champions in all categories as Abdulbasit Abdulfatai, a Southpaw player from Kwara State dethroned Matthew Kuti to become the new U19 champion after a thrilling and suspense full final.
In the girls’ U-19 final, Ayoola fought back from the brink of defeat to beat Aishat Rabiu 4-3 (11-9, 8-11, 14-16 , 8-11, 11-2, 11-5, 11-4) and become the new champion.
For the first time in the history of table tennis in Nigeria, Abia State claimed their first national title as Chinenye Okafor beat Ifeoluwa Ajasa of Lagos State 3-2 (11-5, 11-9, 11-13 , 9-11, 11-6).
In the Boys’ U-15, Abdulamid Adebayo of Lagos stunned Samuel Dada of Kogi 3-2 (4-11, 6-11, 11-7, 11-5, 11-7) to become the new boys’ champion.
The importance of the annual event is not only for Nigerians in the diaspora, since the advent of COVID-19 some years ago, there has been a steady dwindle of table tennis competitions in the country, and the championships have become a beacon of hope for aspiring ping pongers.
Other highlights of the event apart from the prize monies and sharing of souvenirs with all participants is the guest artist appearance of Akande Abolore Adegbola popularly known as 9ice, who played a novelty game with the special guest of the occasion Abike Dabiri-Erewa, to the amusement of the spectators.
As a prove that that the championships is the annual confluence of Nigerians in the diaspora, notable persons that grace the occasion include Remi Babalola, a former Minister of State for Finance and former chairman, board of directors of First Bank Holdings, Professor Bamitale Omole, former Vice-chancellor, Obafemi Awolowo University, who recently celebrated his 70th birthday was also in attendance.
Mrs Edun, wife of Yemi Edun, Gboyega Fatimilehin, an Estate Surveyor and co-founder, Diya Fatimilehin, the head of Table Tennis in Africa, Barrister Enitan Oshodi led the Table Tennis top dignitaries to the occasion.
Bosun Omoniyi and his wife, Sola Osinaike, The Anthony Tejuoso Family, Olumide Coker, Dipo Davies of Castle magazine, Bunmi and Serekunmi Obanubi, Hon. Ojuri, Barrister and Mrs Bayo Koku, Abayomi Ajao of DUISSE, Koye Sax and Doyin Akinnurin from the USA were in attendance.
During the interview with Journalists, the Director-General, of Lagos Sports Commission, Lekan Fatodu, whose mission in the state is to promote grassroots sports, identify and nurture talents acknowledged the impact of the championships in the state as a platform that can achieve the vision and mission of Governor Babajide Sanwo-Olu in the area of Sports.
Beyond the main event of the day, some crème de la crème were seen on camera laughing, smiling and sharing pleasantries, caught on camera including Wale Edun, Olabode Ojuri, Remi Coker, David Coker, Joseph Edgar, the Duke of Shomolu, Ope Oye, Kolade Giwa – Osagie, Kanmi Osobu, Mr Femi Oduntan, were seen enjoying the sportainment atmosphere of the hub
As the third edition commences in earnest, The 2025 Daniel Ford Elite Youth National Table Tennis Championships will take place tentatively for the 19th and 20th of December .
Mudashiru Shittu writes from Lagos
National 0 1 Share

author: PChome Online 新聞
title: 影/大寮清晨「電鍍廠燒起來」！ 環保局急測空污指數
text:
影/大寮清晨「電鍍廠燒起來」！ 環保局急測空污指數
最新消息，今（6日）清晨5點左右，在高雄市大寮區的大發工業區裡，有家電鍍廠不明原因起火，警消獲報出動16人、8車趕往，環保局也緊急派員到場測量空污指數，據了解，起火點疑似是儲存藥水的塑膠櫃，火警發生當下工廠內正在值班的移工也拿起滅火器衝過去滅火，所幸整起火警無人傷亡，火勢在15分鐘內撲滅，但確切的起火原因、是否有人為縱火可能，仍有待火調科跟警方調查釐清，若有更進一步的消息，《中天新聞網》會為您持續掌握。
火災現場。（圖／中天新聞）

author: MENAFN
title: Curfew Declared In Northwest US City Of Spokane After Protests: Mayor
text:
Curfew Declared In Northwest US City Of Spokane After Protests: Mayor
MENAFN- The Peninsula) AFP
Washington: Authorities in the northwest US city of Spokane, Washington, declared a nighttime curfew Wednesday following protests against President Donald Trump's immigration crackdown.
"Mayor Lisa Brown has issued a curfew to begin at 9:30 p.m. Wednesday," the mayor's office posted on Facebook.
The curfew will last until 5:00 am (1200 GMT), it added.

author: PTI
title: Flight operations suspended in Bengal's Andal airport due to rain water logging - The Week
text:
Kolkata, Aug 2 (PTI) Flight operations to and from the Kazi Nazrul Islam (KNI) airport at Andal in West Bengal’s Paschim Bardhaman district were temporarily suspended on Friday due to water logging in and around its premises, officials said.
 Around three flights, including one from New Delhi and another from Bengaluru, had to be cancelled for the day, they said.
 The district recorded around 192 mm of rainfall overnight.
 The passengers were informed about the problem with ample time in hand to minimise inconvenience caused to them, KNI airport authorities said.
 The first flight was scheduled to land at the airport at 12.50 pm, they said.
 Water gushed into the airport premises and caused water logging in the operational area, an official said. Several places at the approach road to the airport from the highway were also inundated, he said.
 In a statement issued later, Bengal Aerotropolis Projects Ltd (BAPL), the developer of the airport, said due to unprecedented rainfall recorded in and around the Durgapur-Asansol area since Thursday, both KNI airport and the surrounding areas have experienced significant water logging.
 “The situation has been further aggravated owing to a breach of a water reservoir upstream. Due to the flooding at the airport, on account of inclement weather conditions, operations have been temporarily suspended and appropriate authorities informed,” it said.
 The situation is being closely monitored by BAPL, district authorities and local bodies, and steps are being taken for early resumption of airport operations, the statement added.
